examples: State television didn't cover Kim Jong-il's ailments.

examples: As the comedian told the joke, the audience grimaced in a mixture of amusement and discomfort.

examples: The courts decided in favor of the New York claimants.

As of May 12th, the Sunshine State had paid 36 percent of its claimants.
Ivan IV died in 1584 of a stroke while playing chess, and his heir Fyodor died in 1598, and after that, claimants to the leaderless Russian throne abounded.

examples: The coup gave the dictatorship a dose of its own medicine, subjecting the dictator and his entourage to torture and confinement in deplorable conditions.
Lawrence Livermore is pursuing inertial confinement fusion.
These freedom fighters were kept in solitary confinement as a warning to others.
While Sandra waited for her result, she was placed into solitary confinement.
McFarland was under home confinement outside Atlanta, monitored with an ankle bracelet.
words.defineEn: the action of keeping someone in a closed space, prison, etc., usually by force
words.defineVi: hành động giữ ai đó trong một không gian kín, nhà tù, v.v., thường là bằng vũ lực

examples: I may not have a lot of money, but I remind myself that it's better to have an egg in peace than an ox in war and find contentment in the simple things in life.

And that's not a state of peace and contentment.
Amusement and anxiety are both considered high-arousal emotions, while contentment and sadness are considered low-arousal.

examples: An example, I tore the ligament in my left foot when I was 15.

To make up for the stability that was lost, over time, horses began to rely more on their ligaments.
